Interface PacketSource

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DisabledPacketSource, PcapFilePacketSource, PcapPacketSource
public interface PacketSource extends AutoCloseable
Port that provides captured raw frames from a network interface or trace.

Implementations typically wrap libpcap or replay files. Not inherently thread-safe.

Since:
RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    close()
    Closes the underlying capture resources.
    default boolean
    isExhausted()
    Indicates whether the source has been fully drained and will not deliver more frames.
    Optional<RawFrame>
    poll()
    Retrieves the next frame when available.
    void
    start()
    Starts capture or prepares the underlying source.

  • Method Details

    • start

      void start() throws Exception
      Starts capture or prepares the underlying source.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the source cannot be opened
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • poll

      Optional<RawFrame> poll() throws Exception
      Retrieves the next frame when available.
      Returns:
      optional frame; empty when no data is currently available or the source is exhausted
      Throws:
      Exception - if capture fails
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • isExhausted

      default boolean isExhausted()
      Indicates whether the source has been fully drained and will not deliver more frames.
      Returns:
      true when the source is exhausted and capture can shut down
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • close

      void close() throws Exception
      Closes the underlying capture resources.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      Exception - if shutdown fails
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
